alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo; Santa Barbara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 30 at 2:31AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Western San Luis Obispo and Western Santa Barbara Counties. * WHEN...Until 530 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 227 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rainfall is starting to taper off to showers. Water is still flowing through streams and creeks, causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.50 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen with local amounts up to 1.50 to 2.00 inches. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Maria, San Luis Obispo, Morro Bay, Pismo Beach, Santa Ynez, Point Conception, Nipomo, Cambria, Solvang, Vandenberg Space Force Base, Gaviota State Park, Refugio State Beach, El Capitan State Beach, and Jalama Beach. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
